criteria.evaluation_guide: Look for JavaScript explicitly mentioned in skills section, project descriptions showing JavaScript implementation, or work experience with JavaScript-based applications. Check for depth of experience through complexity of projects described.

Check for TypeScript in skills list, projects built with TypeScript, or work experience mentioning TypeScript. Look for understanding of type systems and modern TypeScript features in project descriptions.

criteria.criterion: Modern web frameworks (React, Vue, or Angular)
criteria.evaluation_guide: Identify specific framework experience (React, Vue, or Angular) in skills section or project work. Assess depth through descriptions of components built, state management, or framework-specific patterns used.

Look for at least one of these backend technologies mentioned with practical application. Verify through API development, server-side logic implementation, or backend service creation in work history.

Check for explicit mention of REST API design/development, API integration work, or descriptions of building/consuming RESTful services. Look for understanding of HTTP methods, status codes, and REST principles.

Look for projects involving microservices design, distributed systems work, or mentions of service-oriented architecture. Assess understanding through descriptions of service decomposition or inter-service communication.
Check for PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQL Server, or other SQL database experience. Look for database design, query optimization, or complex SQL operations in project descriptions.
Identify MongoDB, Cassandra, DynamoDB, or other NoSQL database experience. Look for schema design, document modeling, or NoSQL-specific operations mentioned in work history.
Check for Git mentioned in skills or experience with Git workflows (branching, merging, pull requests). Look for GitHub/GitLab profiles or collaborative development experience.
Look for mentions of Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions, CircleCI, or similar tools. Verify through descriptions of automated testing, deployment pipelines, or release processes.
Identify specific cloud platform experience. Look for cloud service usage (EC2, S3, Lambda, Azure Functions, etc.), cloud architecture design, or cloud deployments in work experience.
Check for Docker and/or Kubernetes experience. Look for container creation, orchestration, or containerized application deployment in project descriptions.
Look for mentions of Agile, Scrum, Kanban, or sprint-based development in work experience. Check for roles like Scrum team member, sprint planning participation, or Agile ceremonies.

Check for DevOps tools and practices such as infrastructure as code, monitoring, logging, automation scripts, or DevOps culture participation. Look for tools like Terraform, Ansible, or monitoring solutions.
Look for GitHub profile links, mentions of open-source projects contributed to, or maintained open-source libraries. Check for pull requests, issues filed, or project maintainer roles.

criteria.criterion: 5+ years of professional software development experience
criteria.evaluation_guide: Calculate total years of relevant professional experience from work history dates. Count only professional roles involving software development, excluding internships unless explicitly relevant. Must meet or exceed 5 years.
Look for explicit mentions of mentoring, coaching, or training junior developers. Check for responsibilities including code review, onboarding, or technical guidance in previous roles.

criteria.criterion: Proven track record of delivering high-quality software solutions
criteria.evaluation_guide: Assess through descriptions of completed projects, successful product launches, performance improvements, or measurable outcomes. Look for indicators of quality such as testing practices, code standards, or production stability.

criteria.criterion: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
criteria.evaluation_guide: Check education section for Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or closely related technical fields. Note: Listed as 'preferred' so equivalent experience may substitute.

Look for descriptions of complex technical challenges solved, troubleshooting experience, or innovative solutions implemented. Assess through examples of debugging, optimization, or architectural problem-solving.
Evaluate through mentions of testing practices, code quality focus, bug-free deliveries, or meticulous documentation. Look for quality assurance involvement or precision in technical descriptions.
Look for evidence of cross-functional collaboration, technical documentation, presentations, or stakeholder communication. Check for clear, well-written resume as initial indicator.
Assess through descriptions of collaborative projects, cross-functional team participation, pair programming, or team-based achievements. Look for 'we' vs 'I' language in accomplishments.
Look for explicit mentions of conducting code reviews, peer reviews, or ensuring code quality standards. May be implied through senior-level positions or mentoring experience.

criteria.criterion: Understanding of scalable web application architecture
criteria.evaluation_guide: Look for experience with high-traffic applications, scaling challenges addressed, performance optimization, or distributed systems. Check for mentions of load balancing, caching, or horizontal scaling.
Check for on-call experience, incident response, debugging production issues, or post-mortem analysis. Look for monitoring, logging, or observability tools mentioned.
Look for senior or lead roles involving architecture design, technology selection, or system design decisions. Check for mentions of technical proposals, design documents, or architecture reviews.

criteria.criterion: Ability to write clean, maintainable, well-tested code
criteria.evaluation_guide: Assess through mentions of unit testing, integration testing, test-driven development (TDD), code quality practices, or testing frameworks. Look for emphasis on maintainability, documentation, or clean code principles.
Look for experience working with product managers, designers, QA, or other non-engineering stakeholders. Check for descriptions of feature delivery requiring coordination across teams.
